title: Instagram Stories Captures Almost 10% of Ad Spending on Facebook
text: Bloomberg's Sarah Frier and Eric Haggstrom of Emarketer talk about the growth of ad spending on Instagram. They appear on  "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Attorney General William Barr says Big Tech probes to be completed next year
text: U.S. Attorney General William Barr said on Tuesday that he hoped to have Justice Department investigations of the big tech platforms completed next year.

title: Facebook to AG Barr: We won't weaken encrypted messaging
text: You can't let in law enforcement without opening the door to hackers and criminals, the company says in an open letter.

title: Can Facebook Stock Rally 15% to $230?
text: Facebook stock has been punished as increased scrutiny weighs on the stock. But 2019 has been a redemption year for FB stock.

title: Facebook is right to deny backdoor into encrypted messages: Roger McNamee

title: Facebook’s video calling Portal devices add WhatsApp login, new features and content
text: Facebook is making its line of Portal-branded smart video calling devices more relevant to consumers, including those who don’t even have a Facebook account.

title: How Facebook Makes Money: advertising, payments and other fees
text: Facebook, which rakes in billons of dollars in profit selling ad space, is facing rising scrutiny over privacy issues, antitrust violations, and its cryptocurrency named Libra.

title: Facebook rejects AG Barr's request to stop encryption plans for messaging apps
text: In the letter, two Facebook executives say giving government access to encrypted apps would 'be a gift to criminals, hackers and oppressive regimes.'

title: Facebook clashes with Justice Department over encryption
text: Facebook is resisting calls by Attorney General William Barr to delay the company's rollout of encryption technology across its platforms, ratcheting up tensions between the tech industry and law enforcement over a pivotal security issue affecting billions of consumers.

title: Facebook Portal TV Expands Streaming Options, Amazon Video Goes Live
text: Tis the season to be streaming and as such Facebook has added more premium content to Portal TV but perhaps where the biggest potential lies for the AI-powered device is in becoming a developers platform.

title: Facebook Tells Barr It Won’t Open Up Encrypted Messages
text: With 1.5 billion users, Facebook’s WhatsApp is perhaps the world’s most commonly used encrypted communications platform.

title: Researchers fear 'catastrophe' as political ads 'disappear' from Facebook library
text: Political ads are "disappearing" from Facebook's advertising monitoring system, leaving stunned researchers fearing a "catastrophic" loss of transparency and accountability.

title: 3 Stocks to Recession-Proof Your Portfolio
text: If you’re worried the economy isn’t out of the woods yet, these three digital-era staples could help weather the storm.

title: Facebook sells off Oculus Medium to Adobe
text: Facebook is selling Oculus Medium — a 3D virtual reality sculpting tool for creatives — to Adobe. The team was an expensive effort for Oculus and its sale signifies a broader rethinking within Facebook in what virtual reality projects they tackle in-house.

title: Cambridge Analytica deceived Facebook users, says FTC
text: Firm engaged in deceptive practices about data for voter profiling and targeting and relating to EU-US Privacy Shield framework

title: 7 Strong Stocks to Buy That Won Q3 Earnings
text: These seven stocks to buy didn't just impress in third-quarter earnings. They will all win going into 2020, too.

title: 5 Safety Stocks to Buy Without Trade War Exposure
text: Tired of all the trade war volatility in markets? Consider buying these five safety stocks that are largely insulated from global trade.

title: Facebook's plans to label state media are complicated — and delayed
text: Social media companies are feeling their way in the dark, and sometimes fumbling their way through new efforts to fight misinformation on their platforms as they roll out rules that are meant to increase transparency.

title: Facebook has a theory that hiding 'likes' will increase post volume, and Instagram is testing it
text: Inside Facebook’s growth and data science teams, there is a hypothesis that getting rid of likes may be an effective tactic for getting users to post more original content on Instagram, three former employees told CNBC.

title: No Libra style digital currencies without rules, say EU finance ministers
text: European Union finance ministers have agreed a defacto ban on the launch in the region of so-called global ‘stablecoins’ such as Facebook’s planned Libra digital currency until the bloc has a common approach to regulation that can mitigate the risks posed by the technology.
